summary: This is an FBI administrative document requesting $50,000 in 'Show Money' to be used in an undercover operation targeting Alfredo Rodriguez. Rodriguez, who was previously interviewed in 2007, is refusing to comply with a federal subpoena for documents related to a child sex solicitation case unless he is paid $50,000. The plan is to have an undercover agent meet with him, show the money if demanded, obtain the documents, and then arrest him for Obstruction of Justice.

persons.name: Alfredo Rodriguez
persons.role: Subject of investigation, individual served with federal subpoena
persons.context: Rodriguez was served with a federal subpoena for documents but refuses to turn them over unless paid $50,000. He was previously interviewed by the FBI in 2007 regarding the same information and is suspected of having lied to investigators. The documents may contain evidence against a suspect in a child sex solicitation case.

events.title: Federal Subpoena Served on Alfredo Rodriguez
events.description: Agents from the Palm Beach County Resident Agency (PBCRA) met and reported that Alfredo Rodriguez was served with a federal subpoena for documents.

events.title: FBI Interview of Alfredo Rodriguez
events.description: Alfredo Rodriguez was interviewed by the FBI regarding information he is now attempting to sell. The U.S. Attorney's Office believes he may have lied during this interview and that the subpoenaed documents may have been in his possession at that time.

events.title: FBI Request for 'Show Money'
events.description: The Miami FBI squad requests $50,000 in 'Show Money' to be wired to an administrative account for use in an undercover operation against Alfredo Rodriguez.

keyFacts: Alfredo Rodriguez is attempting to sell documents subpoenaed by the federal government for $50,000, refusing to comply unless paid.
The documents Rodriguez possesses may contain evidence against an individual suspected of soliciting minors for sex, directly linking this request to the broader Epstein investigation.
The FBI plans an undercover operation where an agent will meet Rodriguez, show the money if necessary, obtain the documents, and then arrest him for Obstruction of Justice.
The U.S. Attorney's Office believes Rodriguez may have lied to FBI investigators during a 2007 interview and possessed the relevant documents at that time.
This document reveals an active, tactical FBI investigation in 2009 aimed at securing evidence in a child sex solicitation case, indicating the case was ongoing beyond the 2008 plea deal.
